ul.li:
Include these codes as defined in http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/who-smart-hiv-dak/CodeSystem/concept-codes
CodeDisplayDefinition
HIV.D.DE253AsymptomaticWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Asymptomatic
HIV.D.DE254Persistent generalized lymphadenopathyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Persistent generalized lymphadenopathy
HIV.D.DE255Moderate unexplained weight lossWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Moderate unexplained weight loss
HIV.D.DE256Recurrent respiratory tract infectionsWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Recurrent respiratory tract infections
HIV.D.DE257Unexplained persistent hepatosplenomegalyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained persistent hepatosplenomegaly
HIV.D.DE258Herpes zosterWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Herpes zoster
HIV.D.DE259Angular cheilitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Angular cheilitis
HIV.D.DE260Linear gingival erythemaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Linear gingival erythema
HIV.D.DE261Recurrent oral ulcerationWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Recurrent oral ulceration
HIV.D.DE262Papular pruritic eruptionWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Papular pruritic eruption
HIV.D.DE263Fungal nail infectionsWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Fungal nail infections
HIV.D.DE264Seborrhoeic dermatitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Seborrhoeic dermatitis
HIV.D.DE265Extensive wart virus infectionWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Extensive wart virus infection
HIV.D.DE266Extensive molluscum contagiosumWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Extensive molluscum contagiosum
HIV.D.DE267Unexplained persistent parotid enlargementWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained persistent parotid enlargement
HIV.D.DE268Unexplained severe weight loss in adultsWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained severe weight loss in adults
HIV.D.DE269Unexplained moderate malnutrition not adequately responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained moderate malnutrition not adequately responding to standard therapy
HIV.D.DE270Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than 1 monthWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than 1 month
HIV.D.DE271Unexplained persistent diarrhoea (14 days or more)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained persistent diarrhoea (14 days or more)
HIV.D.DE272Unexplained persistent fever (above 37.5 °C, intermittent or constant, for longer than one 1 month)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained persistent fever (above 37.5 °C, intermittent or constant, for longer than one 1 month)
HIV.D.DE273Persistent oral candidiasisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Persistent oral candidiasis
HIV.D.DE274Oral hairy leukoplakiaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Oral hairy leukoplakia
HIV.D.DE275Pulmonary TBWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Pulmonary TB
HIV.D.DE276Lymph node TBWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Lymph node TB
HIV.D.DE277Severe bacterial infections (such as pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, bacteraemia)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Severe bacterial infections (such as pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, bacteraemia)
HIV.D.DE278Severe recurrent bacterial pneumoniaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Severe recurrent bacterial pneumonia
HIV.D.DE279Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitis
HIV.D.DE280Acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis
HIV.D.DE281Acute necrotizing ulcerative periodontitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Acute necrotizing ulcerative periodontitis
HIV.D.DE282Unexplained anaemia (<8 g/dl)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained anaemia (<8 g/dl)
HIV.D.DE283Neutropaenia (<0.5 × 109/l)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Neutropaenia (<0.5 × 109/l)
HIV.D.DE284Chronic thrombocytopaenia (<50 × 109/l)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Chronic thrombocytopaenia (<50 × 109/l)
HIV.D.DE285Symptomatic lymphoid interstitial pneumonitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Symptomatic lymphoid interstitial pneumonitis
HIV.D.DE286Chronic HIV-associated lung disease, including bronchiectasisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Chronic HIV-associated lung disease, including bronchiectasis
HIV.D.DE287HIV wasting syndromeWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - HIV wasting syndrome
HIV.D.DE288Unexplained severe wasting not responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained severe wasting not responding to standard therapy
HIV.D.DE289Unexplained stunting not responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained stunting not responding to standard therapy
HIV.D.DE290Unexplained severe malnutrition not responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Unexplained severe malnutrition not responding to standard therapy
HIV.D.DE291Pneumocystis (jirovecii) pneumoniaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Pneumocystis (jirovecii) pneumonia
HIV.D.DE292Recurrent severe bacterial pneumoniaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Recurrent severe bacterial pneumonia
HIV.D.DE293Recurrent severe bacterial infections (such as empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, but excluding pneumonia)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Recurrent severe bacterial infections (such as empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, but excluding pneumonia)
HIV.D.DE294EmpyemaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Empyema
HIV.D.DE295PyomyositisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Pyomyositis
HIV.D.DE296Bone or joint infectionWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Bone or joint infection
HIV.D.DE297MeningitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Meningitis
HIV.D.DE298Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal of more than one month in duration or visceral at any site)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal of more than one month in duration or visceral at any site)
HIV.D.DE299Oesophageal candidiasis (or candidiasis of trachea, bronchi or lungs)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Oesophageal candidiasis (or candidiasis of trachea, bronchi or lungs)
HIV.D.DE300Extrapulmonary TBWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Extrapulmonary TB
HIV.D.DE301Kaposi sarcomaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Kaposi sarcoma
HIV.D.DE302Cytomegalovirus infection (retinitis or infection of other organs)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Cytomegalovirus infection (retinitis or infection of other organs)
HIV.D.DE303Central nervous system toxoplasmosisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Central nervous system toxoplasmosis
HIV.D.DE304HIV encephalopathyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - HIV encephalopathy
HIV.D.DE305Extrapulmonary cryptococcosis, including meningitisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Extrapulmonary cryptococcosis, including meningitis
HIV.D.DE306Disseminated nontuberculous mycobacterial infectionWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Disseminated nontuberculous mycobacterial infection
HIV.D.DE307Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy
HIV.D.DE308Chronic cryptosporidiosisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Chronic cryptosporidiosis
HIV.D.DE309Chronic cryptosporidiosis (with diarrhoea)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Chronic cryptosporidiosis (with diarrhoea)
HIV.D.DE310Chronic isosporiasisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Chronic isosporiasis
HIV.D.DE311Disseminated mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Disseminated mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis)
HIV.D.DE312Cerebral lymphomaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Cerebral lymphoma
HIV.D.DE313B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma
HIV.D.DE314HIV- associated nephropathy or cardiomyopathyWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - HIV- associated nephropathy or cardiomyopathy
HIV.D.DE315Recurrent bacteraemia (including nontyphoidal salmonella)WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Recurrent bacteraemia (including nontyphoidal salmonella)
HIV.D.DE316Invasive cervical carcinomaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Invasive cervical carcinoma
HIV.D.DE317Atypical disseminated leishmaniasisWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Atypical disseminated leishmaniasis
HIV.D.DE318NeutropeniaWHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms - Neutropenia

title.value: WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms Codes

description.value: Codes representing possible values for the WHO HIV clinical stage conditions and symptoms element

display.value: Unexplained severe weight loss in adults
Unexplained moderate malnutrition not adequately responding to standard therapy
Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than 1 month
Unexplained persistent diarrhoea (14 days or more)
Unexplained persistent fever (above 37.5 °C, intermittent or constant, for longer than one 1 month)
Severe bacterial infections (such as pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, bacteraemia)
Chronic HIV-associated lung disease, including bronchiectasis
Unexplained severe wasting not responding to standard therapy
Unexplained stunting not responding to standard therapy
Unexplained severe malnutrition not responding to standard therapy
Recurrent severe bacterial infections (such as empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, but excluding pneumonia)
Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal of more than one month in duration or visceral at any site)
Oesophageal candidiasis (or candidiasis of trachea, bronchi or lungs)
Cytomegalovirus infection (retinitis or infection of other organs)
